intro: Torilis helvetica subsp. purpurea, commonly known as purple hedge parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and clusters of small, purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and is native to parts of Europe. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
